{{also|mund|mund'}} ==German== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/mʊnt/}} * {{rhymes|de|ʊnt}} * {{audio|de|De-Mund.ogg|audio}} ===Etymology 1=== From {{inh|de|goh|mund}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*munþaz}}, from {{inh|de|ine-pro|*ment-}}. Cognate with {{cog|nds|Mund}}, {{cog|nl|mond}}, {{cog|en|mouth}}, {{cog|da|mund}}. ====Noun==== {{de-noun|m|Mundes|gen2=Munds|Münder|Münd­chen|dim2=Münd­lein}} # {{senseid|de|mouth}} [[mouth]] of a person =====Declension===== {{de-decl-noun-m|(e)s|pl=Münder}} =====Derived terms===== {{der3|de |Honigmund |munden |Mundwinkel |Mundschenk |den Mund verbrennen |Mundpropaganda |Mundstück |Mundwerk |Mundwasser |mundtot |von der Hand in den Mund leben |Mundflora |Mundhöhle |mündlich |Mundraub |Mundschutz |Mundart |mundgerecht |auf den Mund gefallen |Mundgeruch |Mundharmonika |münden |Mündung |Weißmündige Bänderschnecke |Schwarzmündige Bänderschnecke |kein Blatt vor den Mund nehmen }} =====See also===== * [[Maul]], mouth of an animal ===Etymology 2=== From an earlier {{m|de|Munt}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*mundō}}. The retention of /d/ in the combination /nd/ is a signature of northern [[High German]] dialects and only becomes widespread after a period in the Middle Ages where the southern [[reflex]] /nt/ is favoured in southern writings. ====Noun==== {{de-noun|f|Mund|Munde}} # {{senseid|de|hand}} {{lb|de|obsolete}} [[hand]] # {{lb|de|obsolete}} [[legal]] [[protection]] =====Usage notes===== * Due to [[conflation]] with the masculine noun, combined nouns based on this one are also masculine. =====See also===== * {{l|de|Vormund}}, {{l|de|mündig}}, {{l|de|entmündigen}}, {{l|de|Leumund}} * {{l|de|Morgenstund hat Gold im Mund}} (originally ''in'' Mund)
